post.title: Why does almost everyone on the internet have an anime pfp?

author.bio:
Da pacem, Domine, in diebus nostris

Quia non est alius

Qui pugnet pro nobis

Nisi tu Deus noster.
author.bio_html:
Da pacem, Domine, in diebus nostris

Quia non est alius

Qui pugnet pro nobis

Nisi tu Deus noster.

body: People like what they like and it doesn't hurt that anime has become popular. I think for a lot of people it's way to express their idealized self. It always makes me think of that Zen quote; am I a man who dreams about being a butterfly or am I a butterfly who dreams about being a man? For some people it may be 'am I a man who dreams about being a cute anime loli or am i a cute anime loli who dreams about being a man?' The veil of maya and shizz. Sorry for rambling, but avatars in general are weird and kind of meta.
body_html: People like what they like and it doesn't hurt that anime has become popular. I think for a lot of people it's way to express their idealized self. It always makes me think of that Zen quote; am I a man who dreams about being a butterfly or am I a butterfly who dreams about being a man? For some people it may be 'am I a man who dreams about being a cute anime loli or am i a cute anime loli who dreams about being a man?' The veil of maya and shizz. Sorry for rambling, but avatars in general are weird and kind of meta.

body: Confirmation bias. While there are quite a few people with anime pfp, it most definitely isn't "almost everyone". You're just not noticing the millions without one
body_html: Confirmation bias. While there are quite a few people with anime pfp, it most definitely isn't "almost everyone". You're just not noticing the millions without one

parent.body: People like what they like and it doesn't hurt that anime has become popular. I think for a lot of people it's way to express their idealized self. It always makes me think of that Zen quote; am I a man who dreams about being a butterfly or am I a butterfly who dreams about being a man? For some people it may be 'am I a man who dreams about being a cute anime loli or am i a cute anime loli who dreams about being a man?' The veil of maya and shizz. Sorry for rambling, but avatars in general are weird and kind of meta.

body: I've watched so much anime my view of normal and not cringe is fucked up so I'm honestly not the best to ask. What changed my opinion the most was I had nothing to watch and I can pirate anime for free really easily. After that I just got used to ignoring the stupid fan service and other cringe bullshit they like to show

post.title: Why does almost everyone on the internet have an anime pfp?

body:
That's not much to go off of. 

Maybe JoJo's bizzare adventure would be a good start then. It does fit those values pretty well, with it's family centric plot. The later parts get less traditionalist with the flow of time, it takes place over hundreds of years, kinda matching how values changed in real life, but it takes a long while to get there, and never strays too far. the latest animated part takes place in 2001 and the first takes place in the 1800s


If you like psychological thrillers, maybe death note, it's like a battle of wits/ game of chess, combined with a serial killer murder mystery. And is pretty accessable to people new to animes/manga


If you want something quite adult and dark Berserk is a great dark fantasy and is the first thing I show to people who believe all animation is for children, shuts em right up. 


if you want to turn off your brain and watch giant robots fight Gundam or zoids


If you want a slow going political intrigue, early dystopian cyberpunk, then you have Ghost in the Shell.

If you like stories where the main character is in an unknown land and needs to re figure out life a classic is Inuyasha

And lastly if anyone ever recommends you Boku no Pico, don't just don't it's the anime equivalent of the alt+f4 prank, except you're going to want to alt+f4 your eyes.
body_html:
That's not much to go off of.

Maybe JoJo's bizzare adventure would be a good start then. It does fit those values pretty well, with it's family centric plot. The later parts get less traditionalist with the flow of time, it takes place over hundreds of years, kinda matching how values changed in real life, but it takes a long while to get there, and never strays too far. the latest animated part takes place in 2001 and the first takes place in the 1800s

If you like psychological thrillers, maybe death note, it's like a battle of wits/ game of chess, combined with a serial killer murder mystery. And is pretty accessable to people new to animes/manga

If you want something quite adult and dark Berserk is a great dark fantasy and is the first thing I show to people who believe all animation is for children, shuts em right up.

if you want to turn off your brain and watch giant robots fight Gundam or zoids

If you want a slow going political intrigue, early dystopian cyberpunk, then you have Ghost in the Shell.

If you like stories where the main character is in an unknown land and needs to re figure out life a classic is Inuyasha

And lastly if anyone ever recommends you Boku no Pico, don't just don't it's the anime equivalent of the alt+f4 prank, except you're going to want to alt+f4 your eyes.

And 90% of the time it's a kemonomimi girl or whatever it's called.

Normally I wouldn't care but since almost everyone has it it's getting to be a little annoying.

body:
Good list, thank you.

I’ve seen Death Note.  Definitely liked the timeless morality of it.  I’ve heard to stay away from the Netflix adaptation.

I’ll have to check out JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure.  Maybe Inuyasha too.
body_html:
Good list, thank you.

I’ve seen Death Note. Definitely liked the timeless morality of it. I’ve heard to stay away from the Netflix adaptation.

I’ll have to check out JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure. Maybe Inuyasha too.

parent.body:
That's not much to go off of. 

Maybe JoJo's bizzare adventure would be a good start then. It does fit those values pretty well, with it's family centric plot. The later parts get less traditionalist with the flow of time, it takes place over hundreds of years, kinda matching how values changed in real life, but it takes a long while to get there, and never strays too far. the latest animated part takes place in 2001 and the first takes place in the 1800s


If you like psychological thrillers, maybe death note, it's like a battle of wits/ game of chess, combined with a serial killer murder mystery. And is pretty accessable to people new to animes/manga


If you want something quite adult and dark Berserk is a great dark fantasy and is the first thing I show to people who believe all animation is for children, shuts em right up. 


if you want to turn off your brain and watch giant robots fight Gundam or zoids


If you want a slow going political intrigue, early dystopian cyberpunk, then you have Ghost in the Shell.

If you like stories where the main character is in an unknown land and needs to re figure out life a classic is Inuyasha

And lastly if anyone ever recommends you Boku no Pico, don't just don't it's the anime equivalent of the alt+f4 prank, except you're going to want to alt+f4 your eyes.
parent.body_html:
That's not much to go off of.

Maybe JoJo's bizzare adventure would be a good start then. It does fit those values pretty well, with it's family centric plot. The later parts get less traditionalist with the flow of time, it takes place over hundreds of years, kinda matching how values changed in real life, but it takes a long while to get there, and never strays too far. the latest animated part takes place in 2001 and the first takes place in the 1800s

If you like psychological thrillers, maybe death note, it's like a battle of wits/ game of chess, combined with a serial killer murder mystery. And is pretty accessable to people new to animes/manga

If you want something quite adult and dark Berserk is a great dark fantasy and is the first thing I show to people who believe all animation is for children, shuts em right up.

if you want to turn off your brain and watch giant robots fight Gundam or zoids

If you want a slow going political intrigue, early dystopian cyberpunk, then you have Ghost in the Shell.

If you like stories where the main character is in an unknown land and needs to re figure out life a classic is Inuyasha

And lastly if anyone ever recommends you Boku no Pico, don't just don't it's the anime equivalent of the alt+f4 prank, except you're going to want to alt+f4 your eyes.
